alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Montgomery; Lower Bucks; Northampton; Philadelphia; Upper Bucks; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hunterdon, northwestern Camden, southwestern Warren, northwestern Mercer, west central Burlington, southeastern Montgomery, Bucks, Philadelphia, southeastern Northampton and northeastern Delaware Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 515 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Roxburg to Gardenville to Chester. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Camden, Easton, Gloucester City, Bethlehem, Cherry Hill, Bensalem, Norristown, Lansdale, West Norriton, Forks, East Norriton, Yeadon, Quakertown, Perkasie, Doylestown, Byram, Riverside, Wilson and Conshohocken. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 328 and 354. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 29. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 15 and 36. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 328 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 2 and 3. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 68 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 19. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 35 and 36. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 2 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern, central and northwestern New Jersey...and eastern and southeastern Pennsylvania.
